description: Touchscreen counter tops that you can use and watch while cooking.
Turning walls into giant monitors, or tvs.
Put in a shower to control it and the bathroom, or play music.
Clothing or gloves with it could be used to control things around you.
Could turn the back of any seat into an interactive screen to amuse kids during car rides.
You could put a coating on your shower tiles and connect it to your water supply system. You could then use this to control temperature, water pressure, flow etc.
You could put a coating on your door knobs and it could use fingerprint technology along with touch combinations to lock the door automatically on exit and unlock it just by touch.
You could apply a coating to the wall beside your bed and use it as a light control panel in order to turn on, turn off, dim the lights or even change color easily, without having to get out of bed.

A cool use of having a coating that could turn every surface into a touch display I believe would be applying this to television remotes. You could customize your buttons and features how you prefer. You would be able to add favorites you generally watch or even switch the entire remote over to a keyboard interface to search for specific shows or channels.

Another good use I could think of for turning any surface into a touch display would be making the door of your closet touch screen with the ability to select specific pieces of clothing you own and bring them to the front of a rack for you to grab and preview how they would look together on you.
You could have surfaces in your home that could be touch and clean. All you would have to do is touch, and a countertop would clean itself.
Turn any surface into an Alexa gadget. Touch the mirror in your bathroom and it automatically will tell you the weather, news or set a timer. You can also listen to music through it.
A keyboard for any device at the touch of your hand. The keyboard would connect via bluetooth or home wifi and could be used to interact with various home systems.

A coating on the entry ways into a home that would serve as a home security system. After the system is set, the coating could detect any movement or touch that interacts with it. The would be more accurate than movement sensors that tend to give false alarms from animals and humans inside the home. The sytem could also serve as a camera and recognize deliveries opposed to intruders.
A desk could be an interactive writing surface instead of requiring you to write on a piece of paper on a desk.
A door could be locked and unlocked using this touch display instead of using a traditional lock and key.

I would turn the outside of my motorcycle helmet into a touch screen display. I would need to be able to see through it obviously but it would be like a heads up display and you could swipe on the outside of the visor to change what info was being displayed, speed, directions, text messages, etc.

I would turn the surface of my refrigerator into a touch screen display. I would use it to display recipes, search for information, track what I had for ingredients, plan menus, make shopping lists and more.

I would turn my windows in my house into touchscreen displays. With this I could then use them to control my home automation system and not have to use Alexa or my phone. It would allow for any window to be a touchscreen access panel
You could put a touch display on a lamp and it would allow you to change the brightness up and down.
touch screens on medication bottles to keep others from opening them. They would have to put in a code, face recognition or thumbprint to open.
Touch screen closet doors. You can take pictures of all your pieces of clothing and it will display what you have and where it is in the closet so you don't have to dig through everything.
Touch sceen windows. You can program your windows to have a tint show up when it is really bright, close your curtains/blinds or even display a landscape from another place.
Interactive Dressing Room A touchscreen display suggests alternative designs and colors , make a purchase or even adjust the mood lighting.
A touch screen display when it touches convert the web page in to braille letters .
A touch screen  stove top that recommends recipies
You could spray your hand or another part of your body and turn it into an interactive display. Perhaps it could integrate into your vitals, or you could just have built-in devices on your skin.
You could easily add a display to an automobile interior by spraying  the dash. This could allow for interactive car metrics or access to car services, like modern day car consoles.

An interactive desk could be achieved by this technology. By spraying the desk with this coating, you would have a large format display which you could connect to a computer. This could be put in meeting rooms and offer a unique way of presenting.
Have a built in phone on my work desk.
Have shirts and jeans that have a Hud display on them.
Wallets and purses with payment infomation on them.
Update old books with interactive pages.
Turn any surface into a keyboard.
Turn any surface into a musical keyboard.
Turn any surface into a table top game.
Turn low income class room black boards into interactive learning stations.
I would use this substance on light switches.
I would use this coating on my tv like how some computers have a touch    display my tv would have a touch display.
I would use this on pop cans. They would have a plain can with art but when touched a touch display would come up with various information such as nutrition facts and manufacturer.
I would use it on my cars dash. It would be nice to have a dash that you could touch things such as the speedometer and then change over and check things such as oil pressure.

I think this could find use in city streetlights. Right now you usually need to push a button to have the crosswalk light turn. Having the whole pole coated would allow everyone who might be shorter (children, disabled,) to easily change the walk light.

A touchscreen surface that can wirelessly connect with any wireless smart device, such as a computer, smartphone, smartTV, smart appliances, and the like. The concept here is to be able to remotely access these appliances, such as adjusting the thermostat for a home heating system, adjusting refrigerator temperatures, changing the channel on the television, or taking a call from a phone.

Would be a great idea to turn kitchen surfaces into touch displays. For example, the outside of a refrigerator, a microwave outside or even the counter surface. Usually those are not good for the gadgets because they can be damaged we have but the coating seems an affordable way to introduce technology.
This would be a great thing to have in schools, like a blackboard or whiteboard. Or in school doors, or locker rooms. Educational touchscreens to helps students.
The back of airplane seats. Could offer maps, TVs and other ways for travelers to get information/entertainment. Also cheaper than having an LCD display.
Mirrors that could be part touch screen display and reflect one's image. It's multipurpose.
Elevators. Instead of having elevator buttons, using this coating to show floors.
Glasses, including sunglasses. We have some technology like this already, that turn glasses into smartphones, etc, but this would be an evolution of that concept.
on the walls in the shower area. You could use it to set the temperature and other features from the shower head. You could play music or videos on it.
on the back of seats in a car or bus. People can use them for entertainment, or communication.
on almost any flat object in a bar or restaurant. for entertainment.

Coat the strings on a hoodie in the material so that you could pinch and swipe your fingers up and down to control the music volume of your phone and be able to quickly change songs on the fly.
Coat the center of your steering wheel with the material so that you can easily take calls through Bluetooth or change songs safely while driving.
Coat a movie poster in the material so that you can have an interactive movie poster.
Coat the back of a tablet and/or smartphone or even a laptop so that you could have multiple screens and improve your workflow and efficiency when using your phone.

Add it to your refrigerator for a digital to do list. No more magnets and less clutter.
The ability to coat a regular notebook. This would be a much cheaper alternative to an ipad.
A touch screen car window. When parked, this would be great for work breaks or when on long road trips. Great way to keep kids entertained as well!
Use this on boxes when moving. This would be great to quickly list contents and change them on the fly. Would be able to reuse the boxes too.
Project the coating onto a greeting card for a fully interactive experience. Imagine a card with a personalized embedded video greeting.
This would make unlocking your car doors extremely simple because you could just enter a code on your window and have it unlock without fumbling for keys.
Using the back of your hand as a touchpad would be extremely useful for accessing email, shopping lists, and many other services and is not something that you can lose or would need charging.

Having a touch screen on the refridgerator would allow me to know what is inside, what is running out or completely gone and what should be added to my next shopping trip. It could also tell me the current temperature, and if everything is working correctly.
Having a touch screen on the handle of pots and pans could tell me the current temperature of what I am cooking without the need for a thermometer. This would be especially helpful when making candy.

This would be very cool to replace your physical keyboard with, just apply it on your desk and type away!

Add a touchscreen to any product in your home that needs refilling and order it as soon as you run out! This would work perfectly for bottles that conceal the liquid.
Add the coating to your monitor and immediately turn it into a touchscreen monitor! Save hundreds of dollars!
Add the coating to your arm and instead of tattoos you can get GIF's!
